title: Tip for Typeface with Notan
content:
I’m looking for typefaces with a special play of positive and negative space, black and white, outer and inner, yin and yang, spy vs spy, you get the idea.

Frutiger has always put a lot of emphasis on the negative space/counters. I also found this font named Mostra (Two) quite fitting:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071125/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/")

What fonts come to mind when you think about negative and positive space? Sometimes, when the font is bold enough or the type is set close enough, positive and negative seems to switch or isn’t easy to pin down. I’m looking for that sort of effect.

Thanks for your input!
author: robster

comments.content:
<cite>“What fonts come to mind when you think about negative and positive space?”</cite>

[Legato](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071125/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=FF%20Legato).  
Though not in the sense of the counters “taking over”,  
but much more subtly. You might enjoy this lengthy  
(and I think very interesting) discussion:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/55783](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071125/http:/typophile.com/node/55783 "http://typophile.com/node/55783")
